author: cmpilato
msg: Fix Issue #1318 -- export fails over svn://.  Some silly pool usage,
and some sillier-still sanity checking were to blame.  (with sussman).
* subversion/libsvn_client/export.c
(struct file_baton): Add 'pool' member.
(add_file): Stuff the pool into the baton.
(apply_textdelta): Use the file baton's pool to store the tmpfile
and its path.
(close_file): Do sanity check *before* doing insane things.

author: cmpilato
msg: In response to Issue #1159 (update getting properties that haven't
changed), make a couple of improvements:
(1)  Don't bother making a transaction to mirror the working copy
state if that state can be expressed by a pristine revision
tree.
(2)  Teach the dir_delta() logic that it doesn't always have to call
open_root(), namely, when the compared trees are identical.
The rest of this change involves teaching client code to allow editor
drives that don't call open_root().  There is a compatibility step
included as part of this change, so initially, clients won't actually
see a difference in the behavior.  But aside from that, the code is
complete (to the best of my, gcc's, and the test suite's knowledge).
* subversion/libsvn_repos/reporter.c
(svn_repos_report_baton_t): Add 'txn_base_rev' member.
(begin_txn): New helper.
(svn_repos_set_path, svn_repos_link_path, svn_repos_delete_path):
Delay the creation of a transaction until we know it is necessary.
(svn_repos_begin_report): Initialize txn_base_rev member.
(svn_repos_finish_report): Use a different metric to determine a
failed report.  Also, if no transaction was ever made, just diff
the revision root on which that transaction would have been based.
(svn_repos_abort_report): Just some little cleanups here.
* subversion/libsvn_repos/delta.c
(svn_repos_dir_delta): Rewrite the main code to delay calling
open_root() until we know it is necessary.  But then add a little
compatibility section to toss then back in until ra-dav clients
learn to not complain about an editor drive in which no
open_root() occured.
* subversion/libsvn_ra_dav/fetch.c
(end_element): Move the closing of the editor to where
</update-report> is handled.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/update_editor.c
(struct edit_baton): Add 'root_opened' member.
(open_root): Note that this wasn't an empty edit drive.
(close_edit): Only do the working copy entries update if this wasn't
an empty edit drive.
(make_editor): Use apr_pcalloc() to init the baton structure.
Suffer the negligible performance cost for developer sanity.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/diff.c
(struct edit_baton): Add 'root_opened' member.
(open_root): Note that the root was opened.
(close_edit): Make someone's dream a reality.
